com.xatkit.core.server

Class RestHandler<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xatkit.core.server.RestHandler<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the type of the parsed payload
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmptyContentRestHandler, JsonRestHandler

    public abstract class RestHandler<C>
extends Object
    A generic Rest request handler.

    This class provide utility methods to parse the received payload, handle its content, and define the content type that are accepted by the handler.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccessControlAllowHeaders

        public Collection<String> getAccessControlAllowHeaders()
        Returns the Access-Control-Allow-Headers HTTP header values that must be set by the server when calling this handler.

        This method is used to ensure that cross-origin requests are accepted by client applications. Note that this headers can be empty if this provider is not intended to be accessed in the browser.

        Returns:
        the HTTP headers to set

      • acceptContentType

        public abstract boolean acceptContentType(String contentType)
        Returns whether the RestHandler accepts the provided contentType.
        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type to check
        Returns:
        true if the RestHandler accepts the provided contentType, false otherwise

      • parseContent

        @Nullable
protected abstract C parseContent(@Nullable
                                            Object content)
        Parses the provided raw HTTP request content.

        This method is internally used to fill the handleParsedContent(List, List, Object) parameter with a parsed representation of the raw request content.

        Parameters:
        content - the raw HTTP request content to parse
        Returns:
        a parsed representation of the raw request content
        See Also:
        handleParsedContent(List, List, Object)

      • handleParsedContent

        @Nullable
protected abstract Object handleParsedContent(@Nonnull
                                                        List<org.apache.http.Header> headers,
                                                        @Nonnull
                                                        List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                                        @Nullable
                                                        C content)
                                                 throws RestHandlerException
        Handles the received headers, params, and parsed payload.

        The value returned by this method is embedded in the sever's response. If the return value is an intance of HttpEntity it is embedded as is, otherwise the server attempts to convert it into a valid HttpEntity using HttpEntityHelper.createHttpEntity(Object).

        The exception thrown by this method is used to determine the HTTP response's status. By default the server returns a status code 200, but it will return a 404 if this method threw an exception.

        Parameters:
        headers - the HTTP headers of the received request
        params - the request parameters
        content - the parsed request payload to handle
        Returns:
        an Object to embed in the server's response
        Throws:
        RestHandlerException - if an error occurred when handling the request
        See Also:
        parseContent(Object), HttpEntityHelper.createHttpEntity(Object)

      • handleContent

        @Nullable
public final Object handleContent(@Nonnull
                                            List<org.apache.http.Header> headers,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                            @Nullable
                                            Object content)
                                     throws RestHandlerException
        Handles the raw HTTP request.

        This method parses the provided content and internally calls handleParsedContent(List, List, Object) to handle the request.

        This method is part of the core API and cannot be reimplemented by concrete subclasses. Use handleParsedContent(List, List, Object) to tune the request content processing.

        Parameters:
        headers - the HTTP headers of the received request
        params - the request parameters
        content - the raw HTTP request content to handle
        Returns:
        an Object to embed in the server's response
        Throws:
        RestHandlerException - TODO
        See Also:
        parseContent(Object), handleParsedContent(List, List, Object)

      • getHeaderValue

        protected String getHeaderValue(List<org.apache.http.Header> headers,
                                String headerKey)
        Returns the Header value associated to the provided headerKey.

        This method is an utility method that can be called by subclasses' handleParsedContent(List, List, Object) implementation to retrieve specific values from the request Headers.

        Parameters:
        headers - the list of Header to retrieve the value from
        headerKey - the Header key to retrieve the value of
        Returns:
        the Header value associated to the provided headerKey if it exists, null otherwise
